definitions.definition: To remove the outer covering or skin of something with a cutting device, typically a knife .
examples: Victor pared some apples in preparation to make a tart.

definitions.definition: To reduce , diminish or trim gradually something as if by cutting off.
examples: Albert had to pare his options down by disregarding anything beyond his meager budget.
definitions.label_groups: transitive , often with down or back

definitions.definition: To trim the hoof of a horse .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To remove the outer covering or skin of something with a cutting device, typically a knife .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , often with down or back ) To reduce , diminish or trim gradually something as if by cutting off.
To trim the hoof of a horse .
( Ireland , slang ) To sharpen a pencil .
